intro: Philammos stenoceras, commonly known as the narrow-capsule philammos, is a unique member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its small, herbaceous stature and distinctive, narrow, capsule-like fruits. The plant typically grows in moist, temperate regions and prefers well-drained soils. Its leaves are finely divided and have a delicate, aromatic quality. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
